Issues.Title: What happened to ContextMenu/MenuItem UI classes?
Issues.Body:
.Net core 3.1.1000

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**

When I updated to .net core 3.1 and ran my windows application I get the following exception.

System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'System.WIndows.Forms.ContextMenu' fro assembly 'System.Windows.Forms', Version 4.0.0 ....

There are no compile / link errors.

Had to switch to ContextMenuStrip and ToolStripMenuItem UI classes to get rid of the exception errors.

Would like there to be documentation or deprecation notifications for these classes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "What happened to ContextMenu/MenuItem UI classes?" (#2614)

Issues.Title: The winforms .NET Core app build error after installed .NET Core 5.0 SDK
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core SDK 5.0.100 - alpha1 5.0.100.16134
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**More info:**
1. The winforms .NET Core app build error after installed .NET Core 5.0 SDK, no matter targeting .NET Core 3.1 or .NET Core 5.0.
2. The WPF .NET Core app also reproduce this issue.
3. The Console .NET Core app cannot reproduce this issue.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
After build the winforms .NET Core app, some error message pops up. [ErrorMessage.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/4014769/ErrorMessage.txt)
![Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/71648977-d4899080-2d45-11ea-8925-0abe02fbdb63.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
The winforms .NET Core app should build successfully.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Install .NET Core 5.0 SDK latest build from here:  https://github.com/dotnet/core-sdk.
2. Create a winforms .NET Core app.
2. Build this app.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The winforms .NET Core app build error after installed .NET Core 5.0 SDK" (#2613)

Issues.Title: VB core project template missing Settings, Resourses, Application.myapp and ApplicationInfo
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
 Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 5.0.0-alpha.1.19625.2
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No
**Problem description:**
A default VB project template should also include Resources, Settings, AssemblyInfo and allow for the setting of the same values that a Framework project allows (SingleInstance might be an issue for now). Many of the values that were in My.Application.Info in Framework are now set elsewhere in VS Core Projects or are disabled (Application/AssemblyInfo).
**Actual behavior:**
The only thing included in a core project is Form1
**Expected behavior:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12789369/71639992-e597ac00-2c36-11ea-89cd-32ed176f98b0.png)

**Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "VB core project template missing Settings, Resourses, Application.myapp and ApplicationInfo" (#2609)

Issues.Title: VB Core projects allow adding About.vb and SplashScreen.vb which are not core compatible
Issues.Body:
I was asked to file this as a place holder for what is needed in new About and SplashScreen Templates for .Net Core and maybe to prevent the current forms from being added to a Core project
* .NET Core Version:
```
Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No
**Problem description:**
In a VB project ported to core with a SplashScreen or About form or where one is add by Visual Studio Add New Item, the forms added are not compatible with Core.
**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
There are 8 errors about My.Application is not a member of ..
**Expected behavior:**
Either the default form has not errors are they are disabled and core compatible Forms are available.
**Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "VB Core projects allow adding About.vb and SplashScreen.vb which are not core compatible" (#2608)
